result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander F Baumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.
Consecutive to: Case 15CM2024

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Roundy's to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with the store listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
Cases 15CM1290, 15CM1861, 15CM2184 and 15CT0609 were dismissed and read in. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander F Baumann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alexander F Baumann in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Count #2 and  cases 15CM1290, 15CM1861, 15CM2184, 15CT609 are dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Klein makes statements regarding sentencing. K. Baumann makes statements on behalf of the Defendant. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant was sentenced to the following. 

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTH JAIL, STRAIGHT TIME ***CONSECUTIVE TO CASE #15CM2024***

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS ***CONCURRENT TO CASE #15CM2024***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription, sign releases;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:store listed int he Criminal Complaint. 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

RESTITUTION:  $967.46 paid to Roundy's (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation) + $200 DNA surcharge.

Defendant Alexander F Baumann in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein requests a short adjournment so she can review all discovery on all files.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander F Baumann in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein states she was just appointed to this case and requests an adjournment.   Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Alexander F Baumann in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner for attorney J Anthony Rosario.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Alexander F Baumann not in court.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
